oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Recital in Sacred Memory of Gen. Robert E. Lee program

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Reminiscing; Episcopal churches; Anglican churches; Women; Commemorations; Churches
Christ Church Episcopal (Nashville, Tenn.); Episcopal Church - Diocese of Tennessee; Lee, Robert E. (Robert Edward), 1807-1870; United Daughters of the Confederacy - Tennessee Division
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page program for a memoral recital to honor Gen. Robert E. Lee. The recital is to be held at Christ Church on January 18, 1914. The program lists Lee's birth and death dates along with hymns, sacred readings and a detailed order of events.

Among Southerners, Lee came to be even more revered after his surrender than he had been during the Civil War. Admirers pointed to his character and devotion to duty, not to mention his brilliant tactical successes as he won battle after battle against a stronger foe. His reputation continued to build, and by 1900 his admirers had spread into the North, signaling a national apotheosis.
